author: Staff Reporter
text:
Judicial Magistrate Court here on Wednesday allowed Thadikombu police to take Inspector R. Gopinatha Pandian (43), one of the accused in a robbery case, under its custody for two days for interrogation.

Judicial Magistrate K. Kavitha, who passed the order granting police custody, advised the police to produce him before the court after interrogation at 5 p.m. on Friday.

Later, the police took Gopinatha Pandian to Thadikombu police station for interrogation.

Earlier, the police had filed a petition seeking permission for four-day custody of the accused.

Gopinatha Pandian was arrested on the charge of robbing a dealer of Rs. 2.5 lakh and cigarette bundles worth Rs. 36 lakh on the National Highway 7 near here and produced before Judicial Magistrate Court I on March 1.

Already, the police had arrested real estate businessman Raj Kumar of Villapuram in Madurai in this connection. Acting on information provided by him, they arrested the Inspector.

On February 12, three persons in police uniform intercepted the van owned by cigarette dealer Siva Perumal of Thathaneri in Madurai on NH 7 and robbed him of Rs. 2.5 lakh and the cigarette bundles. They took him and his driver in another car to Nilakottai.

On reaching Nilakottai, the gang left them and the vehicle, and fled away. Siva Perumal filed a case at Nilakotti police station. Later, the case was transferred to Thadikombu police station.

The police also found that the Inspector’s car was involved in the robbery.
title: Police get two days to interrogate Inspector
